data.title: Not Sure What They're Trying to Do... but It's Not Working.
data.text:
The only way I can describe the Purple Onion is this: A 1980's American Diner had a three way affair with a Gyro street vendor and a Rolly Polly sandwiches while a McAllisters and a Red Lobster watched. Their menu consists of gyros (sort of, but the tzatziki is made of mayo instead of yogurt), American Diner foods (like burgers and fries), "seafood" (a shrimp kabob and a tilapia fillet were the only options last time I was there), Pita wraps (never had one, might be their saving grace), and "bakers", which are pretty much just baked potatoes topped with different toppings. 

Their offering is like the restaurant started out as a diner, decided it wanted to try its hand at foreign (Mediterranean) food, panicked, tried to pivot back to American food, then decided it wanted to be healthy as an after thought. I've had gyros here (terrible shriveled up slices of meat on hard pita with mayo-based "tzatziki" and half a pound of shredded ice burg), as well as a burger (dry and uninspired), a bbq gyro baker (actually that was pretty good, but the potato was a little burnt on the outside, and I eat the skin so that was a disappointment - plus the green onions just were too much), and a tilapia plate (just a typical serving of grilled tilapia - nothing bad, but nothing outstanding). 

I keep going back to this restaurant because my friends like it (like, not love) and it does have decent prices. One thing I do enjoy about it is the ice mint tea that's available - it's really refreshing. And, I'm a sucker for a massive pile of fries (and you get massive piles of fries with the burgers) and one of those ketchup bottles that squirts out a thin string of ketchup. Plus, one of them (not this one, in Hoover, but the one on 10th Ave South in Birmingham) gives a student discount. 

Over all, if you don't know what you want and want as many cheap options as possible while not caring about the quality of the food, this is the next best thing you could pick... if you care about the quality, go grocery shopping. But don't go here expecting the finest gyro and hummus you've ever had. You will be sorely disappointed.

data.title: Not Very Tasty and Overpriced
data.text:
We were so excited to try this place (finally) on our Father's Day outing to Birmingham.  We all ordered the special that includes a drink, fries and Gyro.  I have a problem when my husband and I order the same thing, pay the same price, and because I want water instead of some kind of carbonated beverage, my cup is half the size.

There really wasn't anything great here.  We ordered the sampler appetizer along with our meals, and threw away most of it.  It was very disgusting, and did not look like an appetizer.

The gyros were very small, and I have never in my life seen orange tzatziki sauce.  Which makes me wonder what they put into their tzatziki sauce.   The fries are ok, and their cookies filled with dates are not that good either.

All in all, our lunch was not fulfilling or tasty, was very expensive to boot, and now that we know what kind of food they serve here, will not be back any time we travel to Birmingham.   There are MANY MANY MANY better tasting, larger portion, less expensive Greek restaurants around, and I will be the first to eat at those places.

data.title: This location has a variety on their menu
data.text: When we are in Birmingham and we want wings we like to go to this location. I always order the same...8 pcs combo either lemon pepper or teriyaki flavored. My husband and our children switch up.They never complain about what they order either.

data.title: Choose wisely!
data.text: We love Mediterranean food, so we were surprised to find out that not all Purple Onions are the same. Although the listed menu items are the comparable, we were amazed at the difference in palatability of the food at this location compared to the one we usually frequent (2296 Pelham Pkwy, Pelham AL). The difference was so pronounced that we felt motivated to gave this location a second try. Foolish us - same conclusion. Additionally, the attitude of the people behind the counter was grim (although that likely changes by shift).Do yourself a huge favor - drive the extra 7 miles south on Hwy 31 to an entirely different experience.

data.title: Different than the Usual Take-Out
data.text: Purple Onion has a varied Mediterranean menu with gyros, burgers, kafta, hummus, omelets, baked potatoes, etc. You can order by items or full meals.  I particularly love their grilled mushrooms and almost always order them.  You can dine-in or call-in your order for drive through pick up.

data.title: Fresh Is What You Get
data.text: As mentioned in a previous review, there's a very good reason why this eatery has been in operation as long as it has.  The employees are friendly, they deliver great service, the restaurant (including the restroom) are clean and you get enough food items with your order to share with another person.  It's a bit pricey, but no problem for me as I was able to carry out the remainder of my dish what I couldn't eat.  Their gyros are just great and their french fries, to my surprise were fresh.  Quite an enjoyable meal.  I would surely recommend anyone to visit this location if they have a taste for the food items that they so happily serve.

data.title: Pretty Good
data.text: I visited this Purple Onion location yesterday and thought that the food was great, however, it was a bit overpriced and the service was too slow.

data.title: Poor service & Rude
data.text:
So here is the deal . Traveling on Christmas Day for family and we decided to stop here. 

The place is a converted Shoneys "Greek" Food fast casual, just without the fast part!

There menu is huge and honestly way to big. Looks as if they are desperate to make money so they have about anything you could think of.

When we arrived , 4 people in front of us at the counter.  With the the lady at the register taking orders , she picked up the phone every minute or so when it rang. On the phone for about 3 mins per call. RUDE...... We customers in front of her are here already ready to give you are money and eat. People on the phone will call back.
This never stopped.   Lady was very short with us , did not give us a receipt for our food. Gave us a number and then the waiting truly started.

We ordered: a ribeye pita and a falafel plate. It took 40 minutes to get our food . It seemed as if the pickup orders were more important than the sit down customers. 

The floors were very slick and people were actually trying not to fall . I mean the entire floor was slick. Not sure why.

When I got our food (finally) after me going up to register and saying just refund our money we haven't got our food yet. She turned around and the plates that had been seen sitting there for at least 10 mins were ours.  She proceeded to give it to us and I asked if it is still warm. She said yes and just handed to us without as much as an apology.

Now for the food-
We LOVE Greek food and this was about lowest quality you could get. My pita barely had any ribeye in it and very small portion. 
Also they put mayo and mustard on it, wow is all I can say. The Falafel plate was rice , falafel , salad and hummus. Falafel okay, rice okay, salad dressing on salad good but hard to eat whole veggies with no way to cut it up and also styrofoam. Hummus had a pungent artificial flavor to it. 

Pricing - $6.50 pita, $3.49 fries, Falafel plate $10+ . Couldn't remember exact price since we don't have receipt.  Drinks - total $27+.  Also note you can only get 1 refill on your drink.

So if you wan to wait with rudeness and below standard food, this would be right up your alley.

data.title: Quality Food in a Relaxed Atmosphere
data.text: Very spacious and clean with a courteous staff.  The food is very delicious. The location is very convenient and easy to get in and out. It may have a perception of being fast food but the quality and taste certainly would not be in the same category.

data.title: Great Beef Kabobs
data.text:
We're New Orleans foodies in Hoover for the SEC baseball tournament.  The Purple Onion was a great find.  I had read about the beef kabobs on TripAdvisor and couldn't resist.  Very tender cuts of beef, fresh veggies, salad with big chunk of feta.  Great food & portions, excellent value.
The facility looks as if it was once a fast-food place...you place your order at the counter, take your seat and fairly quickly your order is brought to your table.  Very informal.
We look forward to returning, no doubt!

data.title: Meh.
data.text:
Stopped here on the way home from a weekend road trip on Easter Sunday. Didn't have a whole lot of time to research where we wanted to grab a quick lunch, but saw some positive reviews on Trip Advisor and thought we'd give it a try.

The food was just ok. We both had a falafel sandwich platter. That meant it was a wrap,  and came with fries and a drink.

The sandwich was bland, dry and I was underwhelmed. It seemed lazy to just serve it with french fries.

The positive here was the staff at the counter - a very nice and friendly young man. And, the iced tea, which had a minty flavor, and was very good. I love all things mint, so this was a positive! I could have brought it all home with me.

The negatives were... it's kind of like a no-name brand fast food restaurant inside, so the decor is non-existent. They could use some updating, everything seems a bit old and a little unkempt. When I went to the ladies room and used one of the stalls, there was a circular hole - wide open - about the size of two large quarters - in the door facing the sinks. Anyone could have peeked in to my stall! This should be updated/fixed immediately for privacy reasons.

Was happy to find something open on Easter while we were on the road, but this place was just ok in my opinion.

data.title: Very different and good
data.text: I like to stop here and get something different and am always pleased with the food and they always give a good size portion ever time. Wish they had one in Decatur or Huntsville.

data.title: Square processed chicken patties now
data.text: Used to be your chicken parmesan was a real chicken breast. Now it is a square piece of processed meat pressed about 1/4 inch thick that is heavily coated with some kind of breading. It is obviously coming out of a bag of 'em in the freezer. (Think those bags of cheap chicken patties you can buy in the freezer at the grocery store.) And it doesn't taste like chicken; this is fast food crap. So, poor quality food for the same price. I asked when they stopped using real chicken. Here's the scoop: if you ask for grilled chicken, you get real chicken. If your recipe calls for fried chicken, it is processed food. A square, tasteless frozen food blob for $8.29 and plastic silverware. Please....get thee to Zaxby's.

data.title: Hit the Spot
data.text: I had this for the first time over the weekend while I was visiting from out of town and it really hit the spot! It was the perfect late night food after a night of drinking. I had a gyro and it was fantastic! It was wrapped up perfectly and had the perfect amount of everything in it (not too much meat, lettuce, etc. Sometimes you get them over stuffed and stuff falls out all over the place while you're eating). I would eat here again in a heartbeat. Loved it!

data.title: Good food
data.text: The food is good, maybe not great, but you can get in and out easily and can get a group of 10 or 12 in without much trouble.  We like to eat Sunday lunch here on occasion after church.  The plates are good, and the burgers, too.  I've found that the wraps can be a bit dry.

data.title: One of our favorite takeout restaurants!
data.text: We do a lot of takeout and this is one of our regulars.  Any kabob is good, I always order a kabob, I substitute the tabouli for the Greek salad and ask for it on the side, since we do takeout.  Love their Hummus!  My husband loves their cheeseburger.  My son-in-law like the chicken in a sack.

data.title: Bland
data.text: My husband and I ate here tonight. We both got chicken wraps. The chicken was dry and tasteless and the wrap had little sauce on it so it had no flavor. Disappointed in my dinner :-(

data.title: quality of food is variable
data.text: I have been here twice. I would not have returned for a second time except that the group I was with selected this restaurant. The first time I had the Gyros Salad and was sorely disappointed because the gyros meat was way overcooked or just dried out from sitting around too long. The second time I had the Sampler appetizer with Baba Ghonouj, Hummus, Falafel, Kafta, and Tabouli which were all very good, much to my surprise. It was filling enough for a meal and worth the hefty appetizer price. Unfortunately, another person in our party ordered the Gyros Salad and once again the meat was a big disappointment. Service was a problem the second trip as half our group finished eating before the second half got their orders and the place was not very crowded!

data.title: Tired of burgers, chicken or pizza - EAT HERE!
data.text:
Travelling : you're balancing time and miles and if you've had your fill of all the usual suspects -- The Purple Onion is a great change of pace. They're just a short, easy jaunt off the interstate. 

I had the beef kabab platter, (meat, grilled veg's, greek salad, fresh fruit, rice, pita and humus). Top marks for all items. Others at the table had the loaded baked potatoes (and they were really, really loaded - over the legal limit probably :-)  

I will definitely stop again next time I'm in the area.

data.title: Great Food!  They Aimed to Please!
data.text:
I had a wrap and my husband had a hamburger.  The food was GREAT!  I was struck by how the staff was determined to make sure our meal exceed our expectations.  Rarely do I get this feeling while fine dining.

I have no complaints...restaurant was clean, restroom were clean, staff friendly...Food was GREAT!

If you are in the are, give them a try!
